job description:
The Release Engineering team owns version control, builds, and deployment systems for Wayfairs hundreds of applications built by >800 software engineers using several internally supported programming languages. Our release pipeline pushes over 250 Git changesets per day with (mostly) zero downtime to environments including PHP, Python, Java, C#, Javascript, Solr, SQL Server, Storm, and Hadoop.

As a Senior Software Engineer on our Release Engineering team you will be responsible for owning the execution of large projects involving multiple teams and contributors. You will be a technical authority on multiple subject matters within the teams focal areas, and lean on these strengths to educate the team and guide its efforts.

What will your role be?
  • Create software and processes that support complex deployment across multiple data centers at an high level of scale and stability.
  • Own the design, development and implementation of the intuitive tooling engineers will love to use for continuous integration, automated testing, and release management.
  • Research industry trends and innovations to identify opportunities to grow our own platforms.
  • Mentor infrastructure engineering team members in software development best practices and maintain a high standard of quality across the solutions you build.
What will you bring to the role?
  • Experience in designing and implementing large-scale, high-availability software solutions.
  • Familiarity working with configuration management systems and and automation pipelines used for testing and building software.
  • Prior experience with or a strong interest to learn DevOps best practices.
  • A desire to build large scale loosely coupled modular systems that produce value far greater than the sum of their parts.
For bonus points, you will have:
  • A good sense of humor and deadly accuracy with Nerf guns.
  • Experience with process containerization and management with Docker and Kubernetes
  • Expertise with Git (also GitLab or GitHub); Puppet; Python, Ruby, JavaScript, PHP, and/or other high-level languages; bash or other shell environment scripting; Google Cloud Platform or other cloud service providers.
  • An active GitHub account.
About Wayfair Inc.

Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, Wayfair makes it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 10 million items across home furnishings, décor, home improvement, housewares and more. Committed to delighting its customers every step of the way, Wayfair is reinventing the way people shop for their homes - from product discovery to final delivery.

The Wayfair family of sites includes:
  • Wayfair, an online destination for all things home
  • Joss & Main, where beautiful furniture and finds meet irresistible savings
  • AllModern, unbelievable prices on everything modern
  • Birch Lane, a collection of classic furnishings and timeless home décor
  • Perigold, unparalleled access to the finest home décor and furnishings
Wayfair generated $5.2 billion in net revenue for the twelve months ended March 31, 2018. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts with operations throughout North America and Europe, the company employs more than 8,700 people.
